message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about neural machine translation (NMT), which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the computer science category of "Computation and Language" (cs.CL). The paper specifically focuses on achieving open vocabulary NMT, which involves handling rare and unknown words. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of "Machine Learning" (cs.LG), as NMT is typically implemented using deep learning techniques. Additionally, the paper proposes a hybrid approach that combines word-level and character-level models, which could be relevant to the sub-categories of "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI) and "Neural and Evolutionary Computing" (cs.NE). Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on a translation task, which could also make it relevant to the sub-category of "Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition" (cs.CV), as machine translation can be seen as a form of image-to-text translation.
